About Work Career Contact

Contact

You can write to me at luisparramail@gmail.com. Or through social media, you can send me a direct message and share ideas with me.

I found social media as a tool to come up with ideas and learn. I like listening to others, and sharing my learnings helps me maintain a habit of reading.

Below I show you what I do in each social network. I don’t publish the same on two networks as I think it is messy and uncomfortable to see repeated things. I wanna reach many people but offer unique content.

I use Twitter and LinkedIn as “root” social networks since there I put together what I do on other networks. In general, I tweet comments on design news and my work at college and, on LinkedIn, I post short reviews on design theories and ideas, and occasionally an article.

CodePen

I’m learning new things about HTML and CSS. On CodePen, every Saturday I take a good pen of code from a programmer, analyze it and find ways to improve or merge it with something else.

Flipboard

I have a weekly magazine on Flipboard. Each magazine is a collection of interesting design news and articles that I commented on Twitter.

Highly

Here I have a collection of highlights on design research. When I don’t read news or articles, I read a research paper. I publish relevant highlights on Twitter and a summary on LinkedIn. I seek to read at least one article or white paper per day.

Medium

Once every two weeks, I write a formal review on a design topic. I watch an idea from TED, or read an article from a blog, and think from a different point of view.

Pinterest

I use Pinterest for boards of graphic design inspiration. I created one board per art movement listed by The Art Story and add a pin every day.
